page.title: 03FORESTRY
page.content: When you leave Matlock on the Chesterfield road, you pass a large forest.This is called Matlock Forest.The trees are planted very close together but every now and then a wide pathway runs between them. The pathway is called a ride and it would help to stop forest fires if they broke out. In the middle of the forest there are many coniferous trees like pine and spruce but round the edges some deciduous trees have been planted to protect the other trees. When the trees are fully grown they will be cut down and made into telegraph poles and fences.I take my dog, Bob, for a walk in the forest.
